hedline.hl1: Grey Global Group Units Get the Unisys Account

abstract.p: Unisys Corp names Grey Worldwide to handle its advertising account and Mediacom, Grey Global Group unit, to handle media services; Bozell Group had handled account; InterNAP Network Services names Lowe Lintas & Partners Worldwide as its first global agency of record (M)

block.p: Technology advertisers have made decisions on accounts.
The Unisys Corporation named units of the Grey Global Group in New York to handle its account, with billings estimated at more than $40 million.
Technology advertisers have made decisions on accounts.
The Unisys Corporation named units of the Grey Global Group in New York to handle its account, with billings estimated at more than $40 million.

Kerry Baker, director for corporate advertising at Unisys in Blue Bell, Pa., said the decision came after a four-month review that had been narrowed to Grey and two other finalists: Leo Burnett Worldwide in Chicago, part of the B Com3 Group, and McCann-Erickson Worldwide Advertising, part of the McCann-Erickson World Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies. The Grey Global units that will work for Unisys are Grey Worldwide, for advertising, and Mediacom, for media services.

The Unisys account had been handled since 1992 by the Bozell Group in New York, a unit of True North Communications. They parted in May because of a conflict created when a Bozell sibling, FCB Worldwide, became the agency for Compaq Computer.

And InterNAP Network Services named the San Francisco office of Lowe Lintas & Partners Worldwide, part of the Lowe Group unit of Interpublic, as its first global agency of record. Billings were estimated at $25 million.

Bill Hankes, a spokesman for InterNAP in Seattle, said the decision came after a three-month review that was narrowed to Lowe Lintas and two other finalists in San Francisco: Saatchi & Saatchi, part of the Publicis Groupe S.A., and GMO/Hill, Holliday, also part of Lowe.
